alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 30 at 3:55PM MST until July 31 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... The Havasu Creek basin in... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until midnight MST tonight. * At 347 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms earlier this afternoon produced between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain in less than an hour 5 to 15 miles southeast of Supai. Additional rainfall over the warned area will generally be light but runoff from earlier storms means that Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Havasu Creek basin. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Supai and Havasupai Reservation. This includes the following swimming holes... All swimming holes on Havasu Creek near Supai. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Havasu Creek, Pasture Wash, and Hualapai Canyon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Campers and hikers should hustle to higher ground immediately! Stay away from creeks and washes! Foot bridges will be washed out in Supai Campground. Some campsites will be flooded. Campers may be stranded in portions of the campground.
